type: Acoustic Surveys and Experimental Gillnetting of Local Spawning Beds for Fall Herring
short_summary: This project aims to survey fall herring spawning grounds and collect data to develop an index of abundance for each fishing area.
description: The project will gather information on local indices of recruitment, size at maturity, mesh selectivity and relative fishing mortalities. The experimental nets will also be equipped with a temperature logger to collect environmental information about conditions on the spawning areas. The bidders must choose fishers for conducting acoustic and netting surveys in regions 2, 3, and 6, and wharf sampling in region 6. DFO will provide guidance and manage the project.

### Tender Description
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans invites proposals from experienced contractors to conduct acoustic and experimental gillnetting surveys of local spawning beds for fall herring. The project aims to enhance scientific knowledge of fall herring populations in the southern Gulf of St. Lawrence. The survey will be divided into three tasks:

1.  **Acoustic Surveys**: Conduct stratified random acoustic surveys in regions 2, 3, and 6 to determine the relative abundance of fall herring schools.
2.  **Experimental Gillnetting**: Use a multi-mesh gillnet to determine the size composition of the herring schools and obtain indices of age-classes entering the population.
